description:
I work on the trunk version of OpenStack with Quantum backend for the network.
If we list networks through the Nova OpenStack API and if the list is empty, Nova API fails to parse the Quantum response:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/38375/
title: nova net-list fails on empty list with Quantum backend

comments.content:
I work on the trunk version of OpenStack with Quantum backend for the network.
If we list networks through the Nova OpenStack API and if the list is empty, Nova API fails to parse the Quantum response:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/38375/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/32638
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/32638
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/14d3ae58c1ec39edd1b0b2a2a1947c5f8e96bab5
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 14d3ae58c1ec39edd1b0b2a2a1947c5f8e96bab5
Author: Édouard Thuleau <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jun 11 22:32:49 2013 +0200

    Quantumapi returns an empty network list
    
    When nova retries network list and if the list is empty, quantumapi
    should return a empty list instead of an empty dictionnary.
    
    Fixes bug 1189976
    
    Change-Id: I5b8c498a6c86e92d0de14d8de9e55722408c5669
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: stable/grizzly

    Quantumapi returns an empty network list

    should return a empty list instead of an empty dictionnary.
    
    Fixes bug 1189976
